summary: Explore the diverse wonders of the Sn√¶fellsnes Peninsula, often called "Iceland in Miniature" for its concentration of landscapes from around the country. Today's journey takes you around this magical peninsula with its dramatic coastlines, black pebble beaches, lava fields, and the glacier-topped Sn√¶fellsj√∂kull volcano that inspired Jules Verne's "Journey to the Center of the Earth." From rugged sea cliffs to hidden hot springs, today showcases some of Iceland's most unique and photogenic landscapes.

L√≥ndrangar View Point - Two basalt columns soar above the surrounding cliffs. These dramatic columns help to explain L√≥ndrangar's nickname: 'the rocky castle.'

Malarrif Lighthouse - This distinctive lighthouse was built in 1917 to help sailors navigate the treacherous basalt cliffs. The Malarrif Lighthouse is almost shaped like a rocket preparing for lift-off.

quickStops: Saxholl Crater - Formed by a phreatic eruption when magma rose to meet water-saturated rocks. During these eruptions, water, steam, and molten rock explode outwards, leaving behind an enormous hollow.
Skardsvik Beach - This beach is an absolute study in contrasts. Turquoise water straight out of a tropical vacation meets dark volcanic rock that defines so much of the peninsula.

Svortuloft Lighthouse - The bright orange Sv√∂rtuloft Lighthouse stands out against the dark lava cliffs. Built in 1931, this lighthouse has helped generations of sailors safely navigate the rocks of western Sn√¶fellsnes Peninsula. Considered the best viewpoint in the national park.
√ñndver√∞arnesviti - Another lighthouse, √ñndver√∞arnesviti, overlooks the cliffs. Since its construction in 1973, sailors have relied on it to help them navigate the peninsula's rocky tip.
Sv√∂dufoss - Behind the falls rises Sn√¶fellsj√∂kull with its glacier-capped summit. Meltwater from the glacier helps to sustain nearly all the waterfalls on Sn√¶fellsnes Peninsula.
Bjarnarfoss - The Lady of the Mountain once bathed here. She is a legendary matriarch who locals consider the very incarnation of Iceland itself.
B√∫√∞akirkja - A black church in a stark landscape, one of Iceland's most famous churches.

schedule.title: Ytri Tunga Beach
schedule.description: Visit this golden sand beach (rare in volcanic Iceland) known for its resident seal colony. The seals can often be spotted lounging on the rocks just offshore, especially during low tide.
details: One of the most reliable spots in Iceland to see seals in their natural habitat
Harbor seal colony visible throughout the year
Best viewing at low tide when seals rest on the rocks near shore
Short walk from the parking area to the beach
Binoculars helpful but not essential

schedule.title: Lanbrotalaug Hot Spring
schedule.description: Relax in this small, natural hot spring located in a scenic valley. The hot spring is surrounded by beautiful landscapes and offers a peaceful atmosphere for unwinding after a day of exploration.
details: Small, natural hot spring with room for 2-3 people
Located in a scenic valley with beautiful views
No changing facilities - consider wearing your swimsuit under your clothes
Free to access

schedule.title: Dinner in Borgarnes
schedule.description: Enjoy dinner at Settlement Center Restaurant in Borgarnes, known for its quality Icelandic cuisine. The restaurant offers dishes made with local ingredients and has a cozy atmosphere.
details: Settlement Center Restaurant combines quality food with cultural experience
Menu features traditional Icelandic dishes with modern presentation
Located in a historical building with exhibition about Icelandic settlement
Convenient stop on your way to Akranes
